thread.title: Freshman standout latest Hunter to compete at state tennis
thread.title_full: Freshman standout latest Hunter to compete at state tennis

author: Rick Peterson
title: Freshman standout latest Hunter to compete at state tennis
text:
Freshman standout latest Hunter to compete at state tennis Brooklyn Hunter a regional champion and 11-1 on the year Posted: October 15, 2015 - 5:43pm 
rick.peterson@cjonline.com 
Hayden's Hunter family has been a staple in the Class 4A tennis tournament, with Paige, Blake and Tommy combining for 11 state appearances, three state titles and a pair of runner-up finishes. 
The youngest Hunter, freshman Brooklyn, will try to add to the family legacy when she competes in the 4A state meet Friday and Saturday at the T.H. Vaughn Tennis Center in Winfield. 
“I'm really excited,” Hunter said. “I've been looking forward to it.” 
Hunter will take an 11-1 record into her first match (tournament starts at 11:30 a.m.) and has won city and regional championships and finished second in the Centennial League tourney. 
Hunter has one of the top records in a state field that includes undefeated junior Sayaka Smith (29-0), the defending 4A champion. 
But Hunter is also one of just three freshmen in the singles draw and said she doesn't want to put pressure on herself in her first state event. 
“I don't want to make myself too nervous by expecting too much, so I'm just going to go out there and play,” she said. 
Hunter said her older brothers and sister have talked to her about state but have just emphasized having fun. 
“They just told me it's a really good experience and to have fun with my team and just do the best that I can,” she said. 
Hunter will be joined at state by senior teammates Kathleen Kramer and Brenna Meier, who finished sixth at regionals and will take a 10-12 record into the state meet. 
CLASS 6A 
Washburn Rural qualified five players for the state tournament at Olathe's College Boulevard Activity Center, led by regional doubles champions Darby Hirsch and Avery Munns. 
Hirsch, a senior, and Munns, a junior, will take a 27-5 record to state (11:30 a.m. start Friday) while the Junior Blues also qualified the doubles team of Olivia Taylor and Lindsey Wagaman and senior singles player Laura Nicolae. 
Nicolae finished third at regionals and is 22-12 on the year while Taylor and Wagaman took sixth at regionals and are 20-9. 
CLASS 5A 
Seaman and Shawnee Heights will both be well-represented in the 5A state meet at Valley Center, with the Vikings qualifying five players and the T-Birds four. 
Seaman's doubles team of senior Sarah Knight and junior Shyanne Osterhaus finished second at regionals and are a glossy 29-2 on the year while seniors Mallory Lantz and Brenlee Yingling (24-4), were fifth in the regional tournament and the Vikings also qualified junior singles player Bailey Chinn (19-14), who took sixth at regionals. 
Shawnee Heights qualified both its singles players, seniors Madison Lysaught and Madison Foster, as well as the doubles team of junior Mallory Lysaught and freshman Madeline Lysaught. 
Madison Lysaught (19-6) was fourth at regionals and Foster (24-6) fifth, while Mallory and Madeline Lysaught (13-10) took fourth. 
The state meet will start at 11:30 a.m. Friday. 
CITY QUALIFIERS 
CLASS 6A AT OLATHE 
Washburn Rural — Singles: Laura Nicolae, sr., 22-12. Doubles: Darby Hirsch, sr., and Avery Munns, jr., 27-5; Olivia Taylor, sr., and Lindsey Wagaman, sr., 20-9. 
CLASS 5A AT VALLEY CENTER 
Seaman — Singles: Bailey Chinn, jr., 19-14. Doubles: Sarah Knight, sr., and Shyanne Osterhaus, jr., 29-2; Mallory Lantz, sr., and Brenlee Yingling, sr., 24-4. 
Shawnee Heights — Singles: Madison Lysaught, sr., 19-6; Madison Foster, sr., 24-6. Doubles: Madeline Lysaught, fr., and Mallory Lysaught, jr., 13-10. 
CLASS 4A AT WINFIELD 
Hayden — Singles: Brooklyn Hunter, fr., 11-1. Doubles: Kathleen Kramer, sr., and Brenna Meier, sr., Hayden, 10-12. 
Rick Peterson can be reached at (785) 295-1129 or rick.peterson@cjonline.com .
